;;2023-10-02T21:20:01Z;
;
;;2023 年 10 月 1 日，霍夫纳与双人跳伞运动员德里克·巴克斯特 (Derek Baxter) 在伊利诺伊州渥太华的芝加哥跳伞中心从空中坠落。 div>;

;一位 104 岁的芝加哥妇女将助行器留在地上，在伊利诺伊州北部进行了双人跳伞，她希望能够被认证为有史以来最年长的跳伞者。

;
;

;;相关：;;美国妇女打破了女性最长胡须的吉尼斯世界纪录;

; ;

;“年龄只是一个数字，”周日在芝加哥跳伞中心落地后不久，多萝西·霍夫纳 (Dorothy Hoffner) 对欢呼的人群说道据《芝加哥论坛报》报道，位于渥太华，距芝加哥西南约 85 英里（140 公里）。

;

;最年长跳伞运动员吉尼斯世界纪录由瑞典 103 岁的 Linnéa Ingegärd Larsson 于 2022 年 5 月创造。但据 WLS-TV 报道，芝加哥跳伞中心正在努力让吉尼斯世界纪录认证霍夫纳的跳伞记录。

; ;

;霍夫纳在 100 岁时第一次跳伞。周日，她把助行器留在了离飞机不远的地方——一架 Skyvan——并在人的搀扶下走上台阶，加入了等待在飞机内跳伞的其他人。< /p>;

;“走吧，走吧，杰罗尼莫！”霍夫纳在她终于坐下后说道。

;

;当她第一次跳伞时，她说她必须被推出飞机。但周日，霍夫纳在美国降落伞协会认证的教练的帮助下，坚持从 13,500 英尺（4,100 米）的高空带头跳伞。

;

;当飞机升到高空且后舱门打开时，她显得平静而自信。就在她拖着脚步走向边缘并跳到空中之前不久，露出了下面远处棕褐色的庄稼地。她头先从飞机上摔下来，在空中完成了一次完美的前滚，然后以自由落体方式稳定飞行，腹部面向地面。

; ;

;潜水持续了七分钟，包括她的降落伞缓慢下降到地面。着陆时，风将霍夫纳的白发吹到了后面——她紧紧抓住窄肩上的安全带，抬起双腿，轻轻地扑通扑通地落在草地着陆区。

;

;朋友们纷纷冲进来表示祝贺，有人拿来了霍夫纳的红色步行者。她迅速站起来，有人问她回到地面的感觉如何。

; ;

;“太棒了，”霍夫纳说。 “但那里真是太棒了。整个事情令人愉快、美妙，再好不过了。”

;

;跳伞后，霍夫纳的思绪很快转向未来和其他挑战。这位终生居住在芝加哥的女士将于 12 月迎来 105 岁生日，她表示接下来她可能会乘坐热气球。

;

;“我从未坐过其中的任何一个，”她说。

;; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 05:52:01 +0800 Former Abercrombie & Fitch CEO accused of exploiting young men for sexhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/02/former-abercrombie-fitch-ceo-accused-of-exploiting-young-men-for-sex
;;2023-10-02T20:58:50Z;
;
;;迈克·杰弗里斯 (Mike Jeffries) 2005 年在纽约举行的 Abercrombie & Fitch 活动。
;

;前首席执行官Abercrombie & 的根据 BBC 的一项调查，菲奇被指控在他和他的伴侣在美国和世界各地举办的活动中利用年轻男性进行性剥削。

;

;大多数男性还指控一名中间人，该中间人是该时尚品牌前老板迈克·杰弗里斯 (Mike Jeffries) 聘请了一名年轻男子，在将这些年轻人介绍给他和他的伴侣马修·史密斯 (Matthew Smith) 之前，通过请求或主动提出对他们进行口交来对他们进行性“试镜”。

;

;在对《Panorama》进行为期两年的调查;期间，BBC 记者 Rianna Croxford 采访了八名男子，他们描述了参加活动的情况2009 年至 2015 年间涉及性行为的竞选活动由 79 岁的杰弗里斯和 60 岁的史密斯竞选。

;

;杰弗里斯曾是美国薪酬最高的首席执行官之一，于 2014 年从 A&F 辞职。一半被招募的男性声称，他们最初在事件的性质上受到误导，或者没有被告知发生性行为。其他人表示，他们知道这些活动会涉及性，但并不完全符合人们对他们的期望。

;

;其中一些人声称他们受到剥削或虐待，还有一些人告诉 BBC 与 A&F 签订模特合同的可能性在他们遇到杰弗里斯和史密斯之前就提出了。

;

;他们还告诉 BBC，在这些活动中，杰弗里斯和史密斯将与大约四名男子进行性活动或“指导”他们彼此发生性关系。随后，这些人说，活动现场的工作人员给了他们装满数千美元现金的信封。除了一人之外，所有人都表示他们对这次经历感到受伤。

;

;出现在全景特别节目中，;The Abercrombie Guys: The Dark Side of Cool;，其中一位年轻人、前模特巴雷特·帕尔 (Barrett Pall) 告诉克罗克斯福德：“我的感觉在那个房间里是：一只动物。对于这些人来说，我都不是人。我是一个身体。我被介绍给某人，做他们想做的事。

;

;“发生在我身上的事情改变了我的生活 - 但并没有变得更好，”他补充道，并在镜头前似乎崩溃了。

;

; p>;

;两位前美国检察官布拉德·爱德华兹 (Brad Edwards) 和伊丽莎白·格迪斯 (Elizabeth Geddes) 在独立审查了 BBC 的证据后，呼吁进行调查，以确定是否应提出性贩运指控。

;

;这些人描述了他们遇到的中间人，他的鼻子缺失了一部分，他用蛇皮贴片盖住了鼻子。 BBC 确认他就是詹姆斯·雅各布森 (James Jacobson)。

;

;当时 23 岁的大卫·布拉德伯里 (David Bradberry) 表示，一名经纪人将他介绍给雅各布森，这名经纪人在 2010 年称雅各布森是 A&F“所有者”的看门人，但说没有提到性。

;

;在他们的会议上，他说雅各布森建议 A&F 的官方摄影师应该为他拍照。然后，布拉德伯里说：“吉姆向我明确表示，除非我让他为我进行口交，否则我不会与 Abercrombie & 见面。”费奇或迈克·杰弗里斯。”

;

;“我瘫痪了，”他说。 “这就像他在出卖名誉。雅各布森在通过律师的一份声明中表示，他对“我的任何胁迫、欺骗或强制行为”的建议感到愤怒，并且“不知道有任何此类行为”。 ”。

;

;这位 70 岁的老人说，他不记得曾承诺过模特机会。

;

;“我的任何遭遇都是完全自愿的，”他说。 “我接触到的每个参加这些活动的人都睁大了眼睛。”

;

;杰弗里斯和史密斯没有回应 BBC 多次提出的对指控发表评论的请求，也没有立即回应《卫报》要求发表评论。

;

;A&F 将杰弗里斯视为其现代创始人，并告诉 BBC，它对他所指控的行为感到“震惊和厌恶”。它表示，新的领导层已将公司转变为“我们今天的价值观驱动型组织”，并且“对任何形式的虐待、骚扰或歧视采取零容忍态度”。

;

;全景特别节目《The Abercrombie Guys》 ：《酷的黑暗面》周一晚上 9 点在 BBC One 播出，现已在 BBC iPlayer 上播放。由 10 部分组成的播客系列《秘密世界：第一季 – The Abercrombie Guys》的前七集将于周一晚上 9 点在 BBC Sounds 上播出。

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 05:22:01 +0800 Matt Gaetz accuses Kevin McCarthy of cutting ‘secret side deal’ with Bidenhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/02/gaetz-mccarthy-biden-government-shutdown
;;2023-10-02T19:33:54Z;
;
;;马特·盖茨在国会大厦外被记者包围
;

;国会议员马特·盖茨继续攻击凯文·麦卡锡周一，众议院共和党议长成功地避免了政府关门，尽管其他极右翼议员也为麦卡锡辩护。

;

;周一，盖茨在众议院发表讲话，猛烈抨击麦卡锡，指责议长与乔·拜登达成“秘密协议”，向乌克兰提供额外资金。权宜之计的支出措施;通过;周六，国会将政府资助期限延长至 11 月 17 日，但并未包括向乌克兰提供额外资金，但两党成员均呼吁制定补充法案来解决这一遗漏问题。拜登周六表示，他“完全期望议长能够信守对乌克兰人民的承诺”，并很快通过一项补充资金法案。

;
;

;;相关：;< a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/oct/01/matt-gaetz-kevin-mccarthy-house-speaker-shutdown-deal">;“让我们来一场战斗吧”：麦卡锡和盖茨因停摆协议而开战;

;
;

;“当拜登总统继续拿走麦卡锡议长的午餐钱时，我的共和党朋友们将很难继续称拜登总统‘软弱’”在每次谈判中，”盖茨在发言中说道。 “越来越清楚众议院议长已经为谁工作，而且这不是共和党会议。”

;

;盖茨周日发誓，他将很快提出一项动议，罢免麦卡锡议长职务，但他拒绝在发言中概述这项工作的具体时间表。盖茨呼吁麦卡锡透露他所谓的与拜登“秘密协议”的细节，并建议最早可以在周一提出该动议。

;

;“今天或本周晚些时候可能还会有其他投票这些问题的答案会牵涉其中，”盖茨说。 “如果共和党成员听到议长必须与我们分享他与乔·拜登在乌克兰问题上的秘密协议，他们可能会对退出动议投票不同。我会听的。敬请期待。”

;

;在演讲结束后对记者发表讲话时，盖茨重申了他计划在本周某个时候提出腾出主席职位的动议，并表示他将继续推动这一问题，直到麦卡锡被免职。 .

;

;“麦卡锡议长获得了 15 票才成为议长，所以在我获得 14 或 15 票之前，我认为我不会比他更拖延，”盖茨说。< /p>;

;盖茨发出威胁之前，麦卡锡被迫依靠民主党选票来推进权宜之计的拨款法案，即所谓的持续决议。盖茨曾威胁说，如果麦卡锡与民主党合作以保持政府开放，他将驱逐麦卡锡，现在他似乎准备兑现这一威胁。

;

;任何一位众议院议员都可以强制投票退出。主席，该动议仅需简单多数即可批准。由于众议院共和党人拥有微弱多数，麦卡锡只能承担在会议中失去五票的代价，但仍能保住议长职位，前提是每个众议院议员都参与投票。

;

;尽管数学计算很棘手，麦卡锡还是做出了回应盖茨的威胁充满挑衅，坚称他有票数来保住木槌。

;

;“我会活下来，”麦卡锡周日告诉哥伦比亚广播公司新闻。 “就这样吧。来吧。让我们结束这一切，开始执政吧。”

;

;麦卡锡的一些盟友联合起来为他辩护，指责盖茨危害众议院共和党的多数席位并赋予民主党少数派权力。在盖茨走上讲台之前发表的一次全体会议演讲中，加利福尼亚州共和党众议员汤姆·麦克林托克指出，罢免这位发言人将使众议院陷入停顿。

;

;“直接影响将是麦克林托克说：“这将导致众议院无限期瘫痪，因为在选出替代者之前，没有其他事务可以处理……我无法想象还有比这更适得其反、更具自我毁灭性的做法了。” “我恳请我的共和党同事们超越他们的偏见、他们的激情、他们的观点错误、他们的地方利益和他们的自私观点，并在我们国家生活的这个关键时刻最需要的时候做出明智的决定。”< /p>;

;

;;相关：;;麦卡锡与民主党合作暂停了美国的停摆。现在他的工作岌岌可危;

;
;

;麦卡锡还得到了国会女议员马乔里·泰勒·格林的一些支持，她是佐治亚州的极右翼共和党人，已成为议长最令人惊讶的盟友之一自一月份当选以来。

;

;在 X（以前称为 Twitter）上分享的一条包含 20 条帖子的帖子中，格林认为盖茨提出的罢免麦卡锡议长职务的动议“让民主党占据了上风”。< /p>;

;“我同意马特·盖茨的观点，事情必须改变，”格林说，“但我不同意退出动议将有效地创造解决故意系统性故障所需的变化，这种故障造成了年度从未发生过的问题。”结束[持续的决议]和圣诞节综合巨额支出计划。”

;

;即使格林团结在麦卡锡周围，她也同时告诫她的共和党同事，他们;据报道;讨论了驱逐盖茨，他是一场正在进行的;道德委员会调查;涉及不当性行为和竞选财务违规指控

;

;“全国共和党人绝对不会容忍共和党领导的驱逐马特·盖茨的行动，”格林说。 “我可以向你保证。”

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 03:52:01 +0800 Sunak fails to hand WhatsApp messages from time as chancellor to Covid inquiryhttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/oct/02/sunak-fails-to-hand-whatsapp-messages-from-time-as-chancellor-to-covid-inquiry
;;2023-10-02T19:23:38Z;
;
;;Rishi Sunak 和 Boris Johnson 坐在外面的桌子旁使用手机
;

;Rishi Sunak 已尽管高等法院裁定部长们应披露他们的通讯以供审查，但他未能将他担任财政大臣期间的 WhatsApp 消息移交给新冠调查。

;

;在《卫报》看到的他向公众调查提供的证人证词中，总理声称他在管理财政部期间“无法访问”这些消息，因为他多次更换手机并且未能备份这些消息。

;

;调查开始听取周二，第二阶段审查政府处理疫情的证据要求在疫情期间（2020 年 1 月底至 2022 年 2 月底）发送关键通讯。

;

;苏纳克于 2020 年 2 月就任总理他的信息可能包括财政部做出的重要流行病决策的细节，包括“外出就餐以提供帮助”、反弹贷款和休假计划。

;

;鲍里斯·约翰逊(Boris Johnson)在表示他将只有在政府官员评估了他因安全原因被迫于 2021 年 4 月丢弃的设备的安全性后，他才交出他在疫情期间使用的 WhatsApp 消息。 7 月，他的发言人表示，这些消息已被检索并提交给调查组。

;

;不过，《卫报》了解到，约翰逊告诉调查组，他在 1 月 31 日至 7 日期间无法访问消息。 2020 年 6 月，这是第一波大流行的重要日子，尽管手机一直运行到第二年春天，但在此期间仍有数千人死亡。

;

;在这位前总理的证人证词中，他建议其他主要领导人当时的政府官员——可能包括苏纳克、迈克尔·戈夫和马特·汉考克——可以交出带有 WhatsApp 或 Signal 消息的手机。目前尚不清楚约翰逊是否已交出他的日记。

;

;Covid-19 Bereaved Families for Justice 联合创始人马特·福勒 (Matt Fowler) 表示：“如果约翰逊和苏纳克不向调查提供信息它要求，他们需要面对法律的全部力量。

;

;“他们要掩盖这些 WhatsApp 的程度......绝对是淫秽的。如果从对大流行病处理不当中吸取教训方面投入的精力，相当于在调查中隐藏关键证据所投入的精力的一半，那么当下一次大流行病来临时，我们将处于更好的位置。”

;

;法院于 7 月裁定，政府必须将可能令人尴尬的 WhatsApp 和 Signal 信息移交给调查，但内阁办公室拒绝这样做，称所寻求的一些材料“明显不相关”。

;

;调查的主席希瑟·哈利特 (Heather Hallett) 要求政府提供两年的信息，其中包括苏纳克、约翰逊和近 40 名其他高级人物和顾问的信息。

;
;

;;相关：;;鲍里斯约翰逊“忘记”了新冠调查所通缉的电话密码;

;
;

;内阁办公室对调查的要求提出了法律质疑，认为该要求过于宽泛。其律师表示，这些信息中包含一些对个人信息的提及以及对可识别的政府人物的评论。

;

;约翰逊在 2021 年宣布调查时曾表示，必须“自由地审查每一份文件”，他反对案件。他将 2021 年 5 月以来未经编辑的 WhatsApp 消息交给了调查组，并表示，一旦他能够将这些消息从手机上删除，他将转交该时间点之前的所有消息。

;

;高等法院裁决后，政府表示将遵守移交所有相关通讯的决定。

;

;预计将成为调查第二阶段最终证人的苏纳克在其证人证词中表示：“在过去三年中我多次拨打电话，但我无法访问在相关时间内发送或接收的 WhatsApp 消息，并且这些消息也没有备份。

;

;“我的期望是如果这些团体的官员认为需要保留通过 WhatsApp 消息传达的任何信息，以形成官方 HMT 记录的一部分，那么这些官员就会采取措施确保这一点发生。”

;

;约翰逊将于 12 月提供两天的证据，他在自己的声明中表示：“在技术团队的帮助下，我们已经能够从旧手机中检索消息。在一段时间内（2020 年 1 月 31 日至 6 月 7 日）消息无法检索。技术团队无法确定其原因。

;

;“但是，我确实预计我无法访问的消息内容应该由其他人持有，如果他们可以的话，我很乐意进一步考虑它们可以提供。”

;

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 01:52:02 +0800 Slovakia’s pro-Russia former PM Robert Fico invited to form coalitionhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/02/slovakias-pro-russia-former-pm-robert-fico-invited-to-form-coalition
;;2023-10-02T16:10:47Z;
;
;;Smer leader Robert Fico sits at a ceremonial table across from Slovakia's President Zuzana Caputova
;

;Slovakia's president has asked Robert Fico, a populist, pro-Russian three-time former prime minister who campaigned on a promise to end military aid to Ukraine, to try to form a coalition government after his party came top in weekend elections.

; < p>;President Zuzana Čaputová stressed on Monday that the new government would have to be one “which will serve all citizens”, saying the coming days would be “a time of political negotiation” not just between parties but between her and party leaders.< /p>;
;

;;Related: ;;Who is Robert Fico, the pro-Russian leader poised to head Slovakia's coalition government?;

;
; < p>;“The next few days will show which parties will be able to find a majority in parliament to support their coalition,” said Čaputová, a pro-western liberal who has a fraught relationship with Fico, whom she is suing for defamation.< /p>;

;Fico, ;whose Smer-SD party won nearly 23% of the vote; and will have 42 seats in the 150-seat parliament, repeatedly attacked Čaputová during the election campaign, accusing her of being a puppet of the US and serving foreign interests.

;

;The 59-year-old is expected to open negotiations with the moderate Hlas – a spin-off from Smer formed after ;Fico's was forced to reign in 2018; amid mass protests over the murders of an investigative journalist and his fiancee – which finished third on 15%.

;

;The third member of the coalition is thought most likely to be the nationalist, pro-Russian Slovak National party (SNS), which scored 5.6 % and with which he has previously governed. That grouping would have 79 seats in the 150-seat parliament.

;

;Analysis have said the Christian Democrat KDH party could prove an addition – or even an alternative – to SNS. The liberal pro-western Progressive Slovakia party, which came second on 18%, has said it will try to form a coalition if Fico fails.

;

;Fico campaigned on pro-Moscow rhetoric that would shift Slovakia closer to Hungary in challenging the EU consensus on supporting Ukraine against Russia's invasion – but Hlas, led by former Fico deputy Peter Pellegrini, would exert a moderating influence.

;

;Fico reiterated on Sunday that he backed humanitarian and reconstruction aid for Ukraine but not sending more arms – although analysts have said this may have little impact since Slovakia's stocks of spare weapons and ammunition are now low.

;

;A Fico-led government would signal another turn away from political liberalism in central Europe, which could become more marked if Poland's ruling conservative nationalist Law & Justice party is reelected later this month.

;

;However, Slovakia's ballooning budget deficit means the new Bratislava government is likely to see continued EU funding as essential to its success, making Fico less likely to seek conflict with Brussels and the country's EU partners.

;

;Analysts have also noted that in his previous terms as prime minister, Fico always managed to reconcile populist, nationalist rhetoric at home with a more pragmatic, pro-western approach on the European and wider Nato stage.

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 01:52:02 +0800 New malaria vaccine approved by World Health Organizationhttps://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/oct/02/new-malaria-vaccine-approved-by-world-health-organization
;;2023-10-02T16:35:09Z;
;
;;Mothers and children wait to receive a shot during the launch of the extension of the world's first malaria vaccine (RTS, S) pilot program for children at risk of malaria illness and death within Kenyas lake-endemic region at Kimogoi Dispensary in Gisambai on March 7, 2023.
;

;A highly effective malaria vaccine has been recommended for widespread use by the World Health Organization.

;

;The R21/Matrix-M vaccine, developed by the University of Oxford, is only the second malaria vaccine to be recommended by the WHO. It is the first to meet the WHO's target of 75% efficacy.

;

;Malaria, a mosquito-borne disease, claims half a million lives every year and mostly affects children under the age of five, and pregnant women.

;

;“As a malaria researcher, I used to dream of the day we would have a safe and effective vaccine against malaria. Now we have two,” said Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, director general of the WHO.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Eliminate malaria once and for all or it will come back stronger, UN warned;

;
;

;Demand for vaccines is huge. However, available supplies of the RTS,S vaccine, the first malaria vaccine ;approved by the WHO in 2021;, are limited. A second WHO-recommended vaccine is expected “to protect more children faster, and to bring us closer to our vision of a malaria-free future,” said Tedros.

;
;
;

;The RTS,S vaccine will be available in some African countries in early 2024 and the R21 malaria vaccine is expected to become available to countries in mid-2024

;
;
;

;The world's largest vaccine manufacturer by doses – the Serum Institute of India – is already lined up to make more than 100m doses a year and plans to scale up to 200m a year, ;the BBC reported;. Each dose costs between $2 and $4; four doses are needed per person. That is about half the price of RTS,S. So far, there are only ;18m doses; of RTS,S.

;

;Dr Matshidiso Moeti, the WHO's regional director for Africa, said: “This second vaccine holds real potential to close the huge demand-and-supply gap. Delivered to scale and rolled out widely, the two vaccines can help bolster malaria prevention and control efforts, and save hundreds of thousands of young lives in Africa from this deadly disease.”

;

;At least 28 countries in Africa plan to introduce a WHO-recommended malaria vaccine as part of their national immunisation programmes. Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, has approved providing support to roll out malaria vaccines to 18 countries. The RTS,S vaccine will be available in some African countries in early 2024 and the R21 malaria vaccine is expected to become available to countries in mid-2024, according to the WHO.

;

;Observers heralded the announcement, but warned the vaccine was “no magic bullet” in the fight against malaria and that it should be used in tandem with other measures, such as insecticide-treated nets and indoor spraying to prevent the disease.

;

;Dr Michael Charles, the chief executive of the RBM Partnership to End Malaria, said the announcement was “a step in the right direction” but that there were still “major hurdles to overcome”.

;

;“In the face of significant funding shortfalls and the growing threats of insecticide and drug resistance, and climate change, further investment must be urgently mobilised to scale up, manufacture and roll out malaria vaccines to ensure they are readily accessible to countries that decide to use them,” he said.

;

;Gareth Jenkins, the executive director of advocacy and strategy at Malaria No More UK, said: “The reality is that malaria financing globally is far from where it needs to be and annual deaths from malaria rose during the pandemic and are still above pre-pandemic levels, so we cannot afford to be complacent as new tools are developed.”

;

;Megan Greischar, an assistant professor of ecology and evolutionary biology at Cornell University, who studies parasites and the transmission of infection, said eliminating vector-born diseases such as malaria is incredibly difficult even with an effective vaccine.

;

;“The current and new malaria vaccines face many hurdles, including multiple doses required to achieve protection. Vaccines will not, on their own, meet the goal of malaria elimination, except perhaps in places like the US where transmission is already rare. In areas where malaria is common, evolution – both of insecticide resistance in mosquitoes and drug resistance in malaria parasites – continues to erode public health gains by making existing tools less effective,” she said.

; Tue, 03 Oct 2023 00:52:01 +0800 ‘It’s a ghost town’: UN arrives in Nagorno-Karabakh to find ethnic Armenians have fledhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/02/nagorno-karabakh-ghost-town-un-ethnic-armenians-azerbaijan
;;2023-10-02T15:39:33Z;
;
;;Refugees from Nagorno-Karabakh in the town of Goris in southern Armenia
;

;Nearly the entire ethnic Armenian population has left ;Nagorno-Karabakh; as the first United Nations mission arrived in the largely deserted mountainous region on Sunday.

;

;Stephane Dujarric, the spokesperson for the UN secretary general, said the United Nations team on the ground, the first UN mission to the region in 30 years, would “identify the humanitarian needs for both people remaining and the people that are on the move”.

;

;Many of the Armenians who fled Nagorno-Karabkah said they felt the international mission's visit came too late, after Azerbaijan reclaimed the area in a lightning military operation last month.

;

;Sitting on a bench near the central Republic Square in Yerevan, Aren Harutyunyan, who left the region known by Armenians as Artsakh last week, blamed the “international community” for the exodus.

;

;“What is there left for the UN to monitor?” said Harutyunyan, 53, who arrived in Yerevan on Friday after a gruelling three-day journey from Stepanakert, the Nagorno-Karabakh capital.

;

;“No one is there anymore, everyone is gone, it's a ghost town.”

;

;Armenian authorities said that by Monday evening, more than 100,500 people, from a population of about 120,000, had fled to Armenia from Artsakh.

;

;In footage ;aired; by the Al Jazeera TV channel over the weekend, an empty central square in Stepanakert can be seen, littered with rubbish, abandoned prams and child scooters.

;

;“Where were the international monitors when we were being starved? It is too late now,” Harutyunyan grumbled, referring to the months-long Azerbaijani blockade of the ;Lachin Corridor;, the only road connecting Nagorno-Karabakh with Armenia.

;

;Hunan Tadevosyan, a spokesperson for Nagorno-Karabakh's emergency services, said on Sunday that the number of civilians left in the regional capital of Stepanakert could be “counted on one hand”.

; ;

;Artak Beglaryan, an Armenian former separatist official, said that “the last groups” of Nagorno-Karabakh residents were on their way to Armenia. “At most a few hundred persons remain, most of whom are officials, emergency services employees, volunteers, some persons with special needs,” he wrote on social media.

;

;The exodus of ethnic Armenians from Nagorno-Karabakh has been described by Armenian officials as “a direct act of an ethnic cleansing”, an accusation Azerbaijan has rejected, saying the departure of Armenians was “their personal and individual decision and has nothing to do with forced relocation”.

;

;Armenia, a country of 2.8 million, faces a major challenge housing the sudden influx of refugees, many of whom “are hungry, exhausted and need immediate assistance”, according to the UN refugee agency.

;

;On the northern outskirts of Yerevan, Tamara, 35, was sitting on a bench near a small playground, watching over her two young children. “I try not to cry in front of them,” she said. “But it is very hard. We lost everything.”

;

;“It's not just our house that we abandoned … It's our history, who we are,” she said.

;

;After leaving her home in Nagorno-Karabakh, Tamara, like most other refugees from the region, first arrived in Goris, a resort town near the border with Armenia, where she spent three nights with her children in a crowded hostel.

;

;Last Saturday, Tamara's cousin picked her up from Goris and drove the family to Yerevan, where she now shares a cramped two-bedroom flat with six other relatives. “Back there we had our own garden and now we have to sleep on the floor,” she said. “But at least I have my children with me, they are safe.”

;

;Tamara said she decided to burn her family books and other personal belongings, including an old piano, fearing they would fall into Azerbaijani hands.

;

;Her desperate act highlights some of the deep-rooted distrust felt on both sides, poisoned by ethnic hatred ensuing from three wars in as many decades. In the 1990s, the Azerbaijani population was itself expelled from Nagorno-Karabakh and hundreds of thousands of people were displaced within Azerbaijan.

;

;On Monday, Azerbaijan's officials said they would guarantee “the equal rights and freedoms of everyone” in Nagorno Karabakh, “regardless of ethnic, religious or linguistic affiliation”.

;

;Most Armenians have left because they do not believe that Azerbaijani authorities will treat them fairly and humanely or guarantee them their language, religion and culture.

;

;For many Armenians, grim memories of the previous round of fighting linger. In 2020, during a six-week war, Azerbaijan took back parts of the region in the south Caucasus Mountains along with surrounding territory that Armenian forces had claimed earlier.

;

;Explaining her decision to leave, Tamara brought up the graphic social media clips of Azerbaijani soldiers desecrating corpses and prisoners being shot dead, clips that raised the alarm of international human rights groups. “I don't see how we can trust Azerbaijan,” she said, shaking her head.

;

;The recent arrests by Azerbaijan of several high-profile officials from Karabakh further hardened the concerns of ethnic Armenians.

;

;Last week, Azerbaijani border police detained Ruben Vardanyan, a billionaire banker and philanthropist, who previously headed Karabakh's separatist government between November 2022 and February 2023.

;

;Since then, the country's prosecutor general, Kamran Aliyev, announced that 300 criminal cases had been initiated into war crimes committed by 300 separatist officials.

;

;Over the weekend, several other senior former officials of the breakaway region were also detained as they left Nagorno-Karabakh, including Davit Manukyan, a former commander of the Artsakh defense army.

;

;It remains unclear how many of those wanted by Baku remain in Nagorno-Karabakh.

;

;“I urge those persons to surrender voluntarily,” Aliyev, the prosecutor, told journalists on Sunday.

; Mon, 02 Oct 2023 23:52:02 +0800 Astronomers sound alarm over light pollution from huge new satellitehttps://www.theguardian.com/science/2023/oct/02/astronomers-light-pollution-tetris-block-satellite-bluewalker-3-stars-bright
;;2023-10-02T15:00:15Z;
;
;;Trees in Cairngorms national park, Scotland, are silhouetted against the night sky.
;

;The night sky is peppered with light from stars, planets and other celestial bodies. But now researchers have revealed one of the brightest objects visible from Earth is a communications satellite resembling a Tetris block.

;

;Scientists say while the apparent brightness of BlueWalker 3 is not constant, its peak is on a par with Procyon and Achernar, ;two of the brightest stars in the night sky;.

;

;“After BlueWalker 3 unfolded its 64m;2; array it is visible in both dark sky and urban skies, though in urban settings, this will be limited to when Bluewalker 3 passes overhead,” said Dr Jeremy Tregloan-Reed, a co-author of the study at the Universidad de Atacama in Chile.

;

;But the appearance of the satellite is more than a mere curiosity.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Calls for ban on light-polluting mass satellite groups like Elon Musk's Starlink;

;
;

;“Large constellations of bright artificial satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO) pose significant challenges to ground-based astronomy,” the study's authors write.

;

;Tregloan-Reed says, among other problems, a large reflective brightness means when a satellite crosses the detector of a telescope, it leaves a streak that can be difficult, if not impossible, to remove so data in the affected pixels can be recovered.

;

;But he added space-based astronomy also faced challenges from such satellites, noting observations by the Hubble telescope had increasingly been affected by Starlink streaks because the telescope was in a LEO, sitting below that of the satellite internet constellation.

;

;While the researchers say efforts are being made by the aerospace industry, policymakers, astronomers and others to mitigate the impact of such satellites, “the trend towards the launch of increasingly larger and brighter satellites continues to grow”.

;

;BlueWalker 3,; built by AST SpaceMobile;, is only a predecessor to a planned constellation of satellites nicknamed BlueBirds.

;

;And there is another concern: the team note the radio frequencies used by BlueWalker 3 are close to those used for radio astronomy, raising the possibility such satellites could cause interference, making it harder for scientists to study the universe.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Picture imperfect: light pollution from satellites is becoming an existential threat to astronomy;

;
;

;;Writing in the journal Nature;, researchers describe how a team of amateur and professional astronomers from Chile, the US, Mexico, New Zealand, the Netherlands and Morocco joined forces to make observations of the night sky, and explore the impact of BlueWalker 3 – the largest commercial communications array in LEO.

;

;While BlueWalker 3 was folded when it was launched in September last year, once in space the array opened to reveal a huge surface area that reflected sunlight.

;

;However, Tregloan-Reed noted another important factor in how bright an object appears was its distance from Earth, with satellites such as BlueWalker 3 in LEO appearing much brighter than geostationary satellites.

;

;Tregloan-Reed added that even if all the reflective brightness of all satellites was reduced to below the level visible by the naked eye, there could be problems. “The sky background glow will increase due to the cumulative effect of having hundreds of thousands of satellites from various operators from many countries in low Earth orbit,” he said.

;

;The study is not the first to raise concerns over increasing brightness in the night sky as a result of such artificial objects.

;

;This year ;researchers called; for scientists to stand up to “big light”, saying the number of low-altitude satellites should be capped to reduce light pollution and preserve the ability to study the night sky.

;Russell Brand 因骚扰和骚扰指控而面临第二次刑事调查跟踪。

;这位 48 岁的喜剧演员兼演员被指控在 2006 年至 2013 年间犯有强奸、袭击和精神虐待行为，当时他在 BBC 和第四频道工作，正处于名声鼎盛时期。主演好莱坞电影。他否认这些指控。

;

;周一，泰晤士河谷警方正在调查一名妇女提出的指控，该妇女两周前联系警方，提供了有关“骚扰和跟踪”的“新信息”。布兰德住在泰晤士河谷流域内的牛津郡。

;

;泰晤士河谷警方在一份声明中没有透露布兰德的名字：“泰晤士河谷警方在过去两周收到了有关骚扰和跟踪指控的新信息追溯到 2018 年。

;

;“此信息正在调查中。因此，对正在进行的调查发表评论是不合适的。”

;

;该女子在 2018 年至 2022 年间多次向泰晤士河谷警方举报她的指控，但没有采取进一步行动。据 BBC 报道，布兰德还曾在 2017 年指控该女子骚扰他。

;

;我们已联系布兰德发表评论。

;

;上周，大都会警察局表示，他们已启动了一个调查小组。在收到伦敦和“该国其他地方”的一系列性犯罪指控后，警方展开了调查。

;

;大都会表示，这些罪行都不是最近发生的，并补充说，官员将为所有性犯罪者提供专业支持。提出指控的女性。

;

;《泰晤士报》、《星期日泰晤士报》和第 4 频道的《快讯》最初的指控于 9 月 15 日首次发表和播出，其中包括声称布兰德在其中一名 16 岁时殴打了其中一名女性。岁的女学生，而另一名女子则声称他在洛杉矶家中的墙上强奸了她。

;

;《星期日泰晤士报》发布了给她的短信——来自一个电话号码，他们说该号码已被多个消息来源证实为属于布兰德——上面写着：“对不起。 That was crazy and selfish.”

;

;A third woman says she was assaulted in the same house the following year after having worked with Brand on a project.

;

;Before the first allegations were published, Brand posted a video online denying “very serious criminal allegations” about his personal life, saying he has been “promiscuous” but that all of his relationships had been “consensual”.

;

;Brand later thanked his supporters for “questioning” the allegations of rape and sexual assault made against him.

;

;In a three-minute video clip, posted on YouTube, Rumble and X, he said the week since the claims were published had been “extraordinary and distressing”.
